text: Edward Burke Burdett (March 10, 1921 - November 18, 1967) was an American brigadier general who was one of the highest-ranked American military officers killed during the Vietnam War. Burdett was the 388th Tactical Fighter Wing commander and had been an F-86 pilot in Korea. In Vietnam while flying an F-105, he was hit by an SA-2 and was forced to eject. Burdett was captured, but he died the same day on November 18, 1967. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1921 births Category:1967 deaths Category:American military personnel killed in the Vietnam War Category:United States Air Force generals Category:Brigadier generals Category:United States Military Academy alumni
title: Edward B. Burdett
